pros: good environment, modern rooms and nice study colleagues
cons: hard to get inside, mensa is crowded

pros: You can work while studying
cons: They did not increase the wage in October 2022, as almost everyone else but in April 2023.

pros: International, good institutes, youthful spirit

pros:
Academic environment 
Good remuneration 
Learning in research group
cons: Considering the odd jobs for students, Hiwi at HHU don’t show any cons

review_title: Could handle complaints better, make sure workers are paid
pros:
- Most of the professors are fair to their workers and supportive of students.
- Other than one postdoc suggesting I could "forget" to control for multiple hypothesis testing, I saw no signs of scientific misconduct in terms of falsifying results, p-hacking, etc.
cons:
- Treatment of graduate students depends entirely on their advisor, and there are professors who regularly keep students working well past when they should have graduated just to have a full-time postdoc for the price of a part-time phd student. The university has not adequately addressed complaints about this, though the medical faculty is known to be particularly problematic.
- Some people, phd students and postdocs alike, work for free when they run out of funding. (Postdocs can't be paid after 6 years unless they get a permanent position, and phd students usually get 3 years of funding for an average time of 4 years until graduation, with the expectation that the professor will take care of paying them from grant money from then until they graduate.) Again, the university is not addressing the issue.

pros: Comfortable city, interaction with other education institutions in the area
cons: students are not very ambitious

pros: Freedom to decide on your own interests in topics within your teaching.
cons: An official part-time job that was actually a full-time job.

job_title: Computational Chemistry Scientist in Gerlingen, Baden-Wurttemberg
pros: The work was good and exciting.
cons: Normal university low salaries for postdocs.

pros: PhD Student it is a good normal PhD
cons: PhD Student it is a normal good doctorate

review_title: Good place to grow as a scientist
pros: International institution, led by experient scientists.
cons: Less international then others institutions around Germany

pros: Literally none come to mind
cons:
field: chemistry
- poor research infrastructure / poor choices
- people (nearly all TAs, some professors) are EXTREMELY rude, TOXIC atmosphere
- poor administrative system, had lots of problems getting documents for grad school at a different uni
- old buildings, always under construction 
- few connections to the industry, no entrepreneurial spirit
- poor salary for TA jobs and PhD positions (like most german universities)

pros: Erasmus Intership. I worked with one of the prof. from university on the topic hedonic games, maths and Java. It was in summertime and the location and people there is very nice and friendly. This internship contributed me a lot.
cons: Nothing as far as I remember

review_title: Not alot of oppportunities for scientists
pros: Nice campus, work hours are not long/ can be flexible
cons: Not a very innovative future-oriented atmosphere. The clinic is focused on being a healthcare provider and not a life sciences hub.

review_title: Multi-disciplinary Research Facility in the Green
pros:
Great colleagues & Profs
Work with accuracy & high Motivation
cons:
Mensa Food sometimes overcooked
Holidays are only in the books

review_title: Could be good for research but not very family friendly
pros: Potentially good place for doing academic research.
cons:
Difficult to find child care for university employees.
Little interaction inside the department.

pros:
Kind of academic freedom
Nice colleagues
cons:
Career prospects not existing
Administration stuck in the 90ies
Very hierarchical

review_title: PhD biological sciences with good ranking
pros: Very good salary for PhD candidates
cons: Rank is not very high

pros: The academic and admin staff are extremely helpful
cons: The University buildings are very old

pros: Environment, city, laboratory, organisation, social life
cons: PhD supervision, food, position, facilities, accomodations

pros: flexible timing with good public transport
cons: low salary with no growth porpects
